{
  "Allegations" : "THIS CUSTOMER VERBALLY ALLEGED THAT MR. HAMMOND EMPLOYED THE USE OF MARGIN IN HIS ACCOUNT WITHOUT INFORMING HIM.  WHILE THE CUSTOMER DID NOT SPECIFY AN AMOUNT, DAMAGES ARE BELIEVED TO BE IN EXCESS OF $5000.",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$15,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE BASIS OF THIS CLIENT'S VERBAL COMPLAINT IS THAT HE ALLEGES THAT HE DID KNOW HE WAS PURCHASING SECURITIES ON MARGIN. I CAN NOT SUBSTANIATE THE VALIDITY OF THIS VERBAL COMPLAINT. THIS CLIENT IS AN ACCREDITED AND EXPERIENCED INVESTOR. THE CLIENT HAD SIGNED A MARGIN AGREEMENT AND HAD BEEN PURCHASING STOCKS ON MARGIN FOR APPROXIMATELY TWO YEARS PRIOR TO FILING A COMPLAINT. THIS WAS NOT A DISCRETIONARY ACCOUNT AND HE APPROVED EACH TRADE PRIOR TO EACH TRADE BEING EXECUTED AND THE CLIENT RECEIVED TRADE CONFIRMATIONS AND STATEMENTS REFLECTING EVERY TRADE. IT WAS NOT UNTIL SAID TRADES RESULTED IN LOSSES THAT THE CLIENT CLAIMED THAT HE WAS  UNAWARE OF THE USE OF MARGIN TO PURCHASE SAID STOCKS. THESE TRADES TOOK PLACE IN THE YEARS 1999 AND 2000. THESE WERE TIMES WHEN PER THE NASD OVER 70% OF ALL STOCK TRADES WERE ON MARGIN AND ACCEPTABLE AS INDUSTRY PRACTICE AND ENCOURAGED BY THE FIRM'S MANAGEMENT. PRUDENTIAL SECURITIES SETTLED THESE COMPLAINTS WITHOUT MY CONSENT OR KNOWLEDGE, FOR I WAS NOT EMPLOYED WITH PRUDENTIAL SECURITIES DURING THE SETTLEMENT NEGOTIATIONS. I WAS NOT INVOLVED IN ANY SETTLEMENT NEGOTIATIONS NOR DID I CONTRIBUTE ANY FUNDS TOWARD THESE SETTLEMENTS"
}

{
  "Allegations" : "UNSUITABILITY WITH RESPECT TO HIGH RISK INVESTMENTS PURCHASED IN HER ACCOUNT.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$13,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$13,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE BASIS OF THIS CLIENT COMPLAINT BEGAN AS A TRADE DISPUTE ABOUT THE EXECUTION, TIMING AND PRICE OF AN UNSOLICITED STOCK TRADE. I ADVISED THE BRANCH MANAGER OF THE TRADE DISCREPANCY AND AT THIS JUNCTURE THE REMEDY IS A $1,200 TRADE CORRECTION WHICH I PROPOSED AND SUPPORTED. THE BRANCH MANAGER FAILED TO EXECUTE THE TRADE CORRECTION IN A TIMELY MANNER THEREBY CONTRIBUTING TO ADDITIONAL LOSSES FOR THE CLIENT. THE BRANCH MANAGER FAILED TO ACT UPON THE TRADE CORRECTION UNTIL THE CLIENT ESCALATED HER CLAIM TO \"UNSUITABILITY\" AND THEN SETTLED WITH THE CLIENT FOR $13,000.  PRUDENTIAL SECURITIES SETTLED THIS COMPLAINT WITHOUT MY PRIOR KNOWLEDGE OR CONSENT. I WAS NOT INVOLVED WITH ANY SETTLEMENT NEGOTIATIONS NOR DID I CONTRIBUTE ANY FUNDS TOWARDS THE SETTLEMENT."
}
